STBLKeyStringList.Text: {0.SimFirstName} has learned all possible potions for their current rank. Practicing magic or experimenting on the cauldron will continue to improve {M0.his}{F0.her} Spellcaster prowess.
{0.SimFirstName} already knows every potion recipe. Experiment will provide Spellcaster XP, as well a chance to gain potion ingredients.
{0.SimFirstName} failed to craft their potion, but not all is lost. They were able to bottle up\n1 Potion of Questionable Contents.
{0.SimFirstName} has learned a new potion recipe and has found a sample.\n\n1 {1.String} has been added to {M0.his}{F0.her} inventory.
{0.SimFirstName} has been taught a new potion recipe and has been given a sample.\n\n1 {1.String} has been added to {M0.his}{F0.her} inventory.
Is that bacon-scented deodorant you're wearing? I think I'm in love with you...
My psychic told me to avoid Sims like you. Please stay away from me.
Are you my long-lost BFF from a while back? No? Oh well, let's be BFFs anyway!
I don't understand why, but I'm pretty sure we're best friends now!
Ooooh, you have a really nice shouting voice! Wanna be my best friend?
All that shouting really made my heart flutter! I... I love you!
That's not nice. You're a meanie.
My mother was right, I should have un-friended you a long time ago!
Your attempt at romance was not the worst I have seen. Perhaps we are destined to be just friends.
I'm going to be honest, that showing of affection was pretty terrible. Try harder next time, okay?
You're not too bad. Just kidding, you're cool. Just kidding, I love you!
You make my heart flutter! This is either an issue I should seek medical help for, or I'm in love with you!
{0.SimFirstName} now has the Immortal trait and can no longer die of old age.
{0.SimFirstName} doesn't have any curses to remove.
{0.SimFirstName} has cleared their mind of all their previous teachings. {0.SimFirstName} may now select different perks.
Backfire! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Uncontrollable Charge while trying to remove another curse!
Backfire! {0.SimName} got the Curse of the Duelist while trying to remove another curse!
Backfire! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Infectious Laughter while trying to remove another curse!
Backfire! {0.SimName} got the Curse of the Night Wraith while trying to remove another curse!
Backfire! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Unwarranted Hostility while trying to remove another curse!
Backfire! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Repulsiveness while trying to remove another curse!
Backfire! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Uncleansable Stench while trying to remove another curse!
Backfire! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Awkward Embraces while trying to remove another curse!
Backfire! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Uncontrollable Charge while trying to remove another curse!
{0.SimName} got the Curse of the Duelist from losing too many Duels.
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Unwarranted Hostility from losing too many Duels.
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Awkward Embraces from losing too many Duels.
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Uncontrollable Charge from letting the Spellcaster Power Explode!
{0.SimName} got the Curse of the Night Wraith from letting the Spellcaster Power Explode!
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Scrambled Spells from letting the Spellcaster Power Explode!
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Uncontrollable Charge from overcharging so many times.
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Infectious Laughter from overcharging so many times.
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Uncleansable Stench from drinking too many potions.
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Awkward Embraces from drinking too many potions.
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Unwarranted Hostility from failing to make a potion.
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Repulsiveness from failing to make a potion.
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Uncleansable Stench from failing to make a potion.
Oops! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Uncontrollable Charge while drinking {1.ObjectName}.
Oops! {0.SimName} got the Curse of the Duelist while drinking {1.ObjectName}.
Oops! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Infectious Laughter while drinking {1.ObjectName}.
Oops! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Night Wraith while drinking {1.ObjectName}.
Oops! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Unwarranted Hostility while drinking {1.ObjectName}.
Oops! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Repulsiveness while drinking {1.ObjectName}.
Oops! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Uncleansable Stench while drinking {1.ObjectName}.
Oops! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Awkward Embraces while drinking {1.ObjectName}.
Oops! {0.SimName} got the Curse of Scrambled Spells while drinking {1.ObjectName}.
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Uncontrollable Charge from failing spell casting too many times.
{0.SimName} got the Curse of Scrambled Spells from failing spell casting too many times.
{0.SimName} is overcome by a strong magical force as all of the the negative energy leaves their body. {0.SimName} has successfully removed all their curses!
{0.SimName} found a {1.String} while out foraging. It has been placed into the household's inventory.
{0.SimFirstName}'s familiar has brought back some exciting magical goods: {1.String}
Your familiar has protected you from death. Be more careful in the near future; death does not like to be cheated twice. Your familiars may not be able to protect you for awhile.
{0.SimName} is not a high enough Spellcaster rank to read this tome. Keep practicing magic and building your prowess.
{0.SimFirstName} tried valiantly to make sense of these mystic runes, but alas, only a Spellcaster can read this magical tome!
{0.SimFirstName} has learned all possible spells for their current rank. Practicing magic or experimenting on the cauldron will continue to improve {M0.his}{F0.her} Spellcaster prowess.
{1.SimFirstName} is now a Spellcaster. You can view {F1.her}{M1.his} Spellbook by opening {F1.her}{M1.his} perks panel, or by clicking on the button in this window.
{0.SimFirstName} is now a Spellcaster. You can view {F0.her}{M0.his} Spellbook by opening {F0.her}{M0.his} perks panel, or by clicking on the button in this window.

Your prowess in the magical arts is gaining recognition. A Magical Care Package is sent to every Acolyte containing some everyday essentials for an up-and-coming Spellcaster. Be sure to check your mailbox!
{0.SimFirstName} has discovered a new potion recipe and has bottled up a sample.\n\n1 {1.String} has been added to their inventory.
The Luck of The Spellcaster is with {0.SimFirstName}.\n{0.SimFirstName} found\n{2.String}
The bubbling magic of the cauldron reveals an unexpected gift.\n{2.String}
What's the best thing about gathering collectables, {0.SimFirstName}? Probably finding extra loot!\n{2.String}
It's that classic "Waiter, there's something in my {1.ObjectName}" situation for {0.SimFirstName}. Only instead of an insect,it's something useful. Check out this haul!\n\n{2.String}
If {0.SimFirstName} was a pirate, these {2.Money} would be an incredible haul. Unfortunately, those days are in {0.SimFirstName}'s past.
Free simoleons? Why yes, {2.Money} free simoleons.
There's no better feeling than finding lost simoleons! {0.SimFirstName} just found {2.Money}!
{2.Money} Simoleons is nothing to shake a stick at. Why would {0.SimFirstName} shake a stick at found Simoleons anyway? What purpose would that serve? They're Simoleons, they can't be intimidated.
Mopping the floor is usually monotonous, but not today! Look what {0.SimFirstName} just found in the dust and grit!\n{2.String}
Hey! I was cleaning my house and ran across a spare box of collectibles. I'm sure that you could use this for something.\n{2.String}
Here's a fish for you to hold in your pockets. I hope that it doesn't get really smelly in there.\n{2.String}
I'd love to offer you a small token of my affection. Please take this and know that I care for you deeply.\n{2.String}
Potion of Curse Cleansing failed, nothing happened.
{0.SimName} won the Magic Duel and received {2.Money} for being a worthy opponent.
{0.SimName} won the Magic Duel and got: \n{2.String}
Even in victory, the Curse of the Duelist prevents a Spellcaster from gaining significant rewards.
The hours of hard work have paid off as the power of the Realm now courses through the veins of {0.SimFirstName}. Marshal your powers well.\n\nTrait Earned: Slinger of Spells
This Sim craves a deep knowledge of the arcane magical arts.

{0.SimFirstName} really is a potions expert now. This advanced knowledge has given {M0.him}{F0.her} an edge and potions will almost never fail when {M0.he}{F0.she} consumes them {M0.himself}{F0.herself}.\n\nTrait Earned: Master Mixer
This Sim wants to learn every potion's recipe and craft each one!
Sim can now cast long distances (without having to move closer to the target). Also, Sims no longer know who cast the spell on them so they won't react negatively to you.
Extra servings will be in the Cauldron each time a potion is successfully created.
Potions crafted by this Sim are surprisingly tasty and have an additional small benefit triggered when the potion is consumed.
Chance on potion creation that all of the required ingredients will not be used.
Sim is now protected from Curses.
Research, experiment, and tome reading speeds are all greatly increased.
Sim reads and does computer research at a faster rate. These interactions also provide Magical experience over time.
Casting spells no longer fails when the Sim is in a Normal Spellcaster Charge range, Backfires are greatly reduced in Charged and Overcharge states.
This Sim now receives more items when harvesting magical ingredients in the Magic Realm.
When experimenting and practicing, Sim gains experience faster with less failures.
Unlock Magical social interactions with other Spellcasters that will provide some Spellcaster XP.
Mischief Spells & Potions always succeed when Sim is in a Normal Spellcaster Charge range, Failure is greatly reduced in Charged and Overcharge states.
Untamed Spells & Potions always succeed when Sim is in a Normal Spellcaster Charge range, Failure is greatly reduced in Charged and Overcharge states.
Practical Spells & Potions always succeed when Sim is in a Normal Spellcaster Charge range, Failure is greatly reduced in Charged and Overcharge states.
Increased relationship and skill gains when training or experimenting with other Spellcasters.
Sim receives a 50% discount on all purchases from the market stalls in The Magic Realm.
Effects on all potions are increased and/or last significantly longer. Sim can now Hex their Potions to have them always fail.
Casting a spell now adds significantly less Spellcaster Charge.
Sim can now always see Magical Motes and collect them. Motes can be consumed for experience and minor, random motive boosts.
All Spellcaster Charge increases are reduced

While in The Magic Realm, the Sim is extremely powerful. They are protected by Death from Overload and can more freely Build Charge and Discharge their Spellcaster Charge levels. Also increased success chance of potion making, drinking and spellcasting.
This Sim can now cast Discharge which empties Spellcaster Charge.
This Sim has significantly increased chances of winning a duel and reaps better rewards from them.
Every Sim will want to be my friend now... hopefully?
Every Sim will want to be my friend now!
{0.SimFirstName} tried to cheat the Reaper and failed. The Reaper will not spare {0.SimFirstName} if they die anytime soon.
Death is no longer the end for {0.SimFirstName}! {M0.He}{F0.She} may fall down, but {M0.he}{F0.she}'ll get up again and again and again.
Drinking the product of failure ensures history's mistakes are not repeated.
{0.SimFirstName} seems to be ready to be the most hated Sim in town... Well, we hope {M0.he}{F0.she} is prepared for it anyway...
{0.SimFirstName} is unfazed by being the most hated Sim in town. Bring it!
The pursuit of immortality is full of failures and accidents. Luckily, it looks like this will pass in a while. Try to enjoy your phantasmal existence while you can.
Using The Power of Love will make any Sim fall in love with me... right?
Now {0.SimFirstName} should be able to make any Sim fall in love with {M0.him}{F0.her}! Completely irresistible!
Feeling lucky? Sims will gain random ingredients or money from Experimenting on the Cauldron and performing other household interactions.
Was that 5 apples or 6 apples? Best not do anything risky for a while.
Something was a bit off with that Magical Aura Potion. It looks like it stopped working part way through...
An aura of magic courses through {0.SimFirstName} veins.
Something went horribly wrong! The amount of emotions {0.SimFirstName} is feeling is overwhelming!
A clear mind is a happy mind!
{0.SimFirstName} is releasing pheromones into the world, but they may not be well received...
{0.SimFirstName} has released pheromones out into the world that Sims cannot resist.
Make it stop! Make it stop... I don't wanna, I don't wanna. Who wants chowder?!
{0.SimFirstName}'s mind is empty, but not quite the way they expected.
{0.SimFirstName} will learn skills much faster as long as this potion effect is active.
{0.SimFirstName} is going to have a hard time building skills.
{0.SimFirstName} is being stalked by something really creepy, {M0.He}{F0.She} should stay as far away from it as possible
Your face has become horrific! Socializing will be much harder and nearby Sims will be disgusted by your presence.
It's a good thing this horrible face is only temporary... right??
{0.SimFirstName}'s familiar fills {M0.him}{F0.her} with confidence. Familiars make your magic more potent and offer a protection from death that is still not fully understood.
Being defeated in a magic duel is one of the most frustrating things for any Spellcaster. Keep practicing magic to have a better chance at winning duels.
{0.SimFirstName} sees victory's face...{M0.He}{F0.She} then realized it was {M0.him}{F0.her}.
{0.SimFirstName} has become frozen, cannot somehow let go. Hopefully it doesn't bother {M0.him}{F0.her} too much anyway when {M0.he}{F0.she} defrosts.
A sudden urge to fight overcomes {0.SimFirstName}.
Brr! It's cold in here. I said there must be some magic in the atmosphere...BRR!
There must be a lot of static in the air, that was a serious jolt!
Pierced by cupid's arrow? This surely feels a bit different.
Guess its true what they say... Never cross the streams.
A wave of sadness washes over {0.SimFirstName} for no apparent reason.
It is never good getting caught Burgliating things.
Nothing is more thrilling than Burgliating objects from others.
While Mote Sight is active you can find and collect floating Motes in The Magic Realm. Keep an eye out for them!
Spellcasting is more powerful, but success chance is slightly decreased. There's also the possibility of becoming cursed so cast carefully!
Overcharged - Magic is even more powerful. Success chance is moderately decreased. Curse chances are increased
Final state of Spellcaster Charge. Great power, but also a greater chance of failure or death by overload.
Due to overmaxing, your chance of successful Spellcasting and Potion making is increased. Conversely, your chance of Death by Overload is reduced.
A nearby Spellcaster is Dangerously Overcharged. No one is feeling very comfortable around them.
That Sim just exploded?! It's definitely time to book it!
{0.SimFirstName} has been channeling too much magic and have paid the price. Tone it down or risk Death by Overload!
Mmmmm, that potion was one tasty beverage.It went down smooth and delicious. The Little Extra Chemistry perk definitely came in handy.
I'm a level 3 fire mage in my role-playing group!
Give me a wand and a spellbook and I'll show you magic.
I believe in science, thank you very much.
This smartly designed ceiling rail brings style to any room, while preventing swarms of pixies from getting caught in your ceiling fan or rafters. Save the pixies without sacrificing style!

Warlock Bixby Beetlestone first conjured this column in the early 1600s while trying to conjure dinner. After several unsuccessful attempts, Beetlestone's spouse took care of dinner and Beetlestone was demoted to taking out the trash. It's a very posh column, though.
I hear you have been building your magical prowess. Would you like to put it to the test and duel me at the dueling grounds?
You got cursed! Are you okay?
Over the ages I have seen many a curse. This one could be serious. Do not gamble with your well being.
Hey listen! You should be more careful! You don't want more curses do you?
You’re cursed? I feel your pain. How do you think I became like this? I wasn’t always a frog, you know.
Oh noes! Are you hurt? Are you okay? Oink, how bad is that curse?
Curses build character. Now you have a chance to learn.
Your curse is only a temporary setback, you will rise again.
A curse? Tread lightly. Where the carcass is, the ravens will collect together.
Cursed! Serves you right for messing around like that.
You got a curse, nya nya nya! Hahahahaha!
I knew you shouldn’t have done that. Now you’re cursed. Oh well, maybe it’ll be an improvement.
You’ve been cursed. If one is not careful with the arcane, one must face the consequences.
Curses build character. Use yours as a way to learn something about yourself.
Hey, that’s my job! Don’t take all the good curses!
Getting cursed is my job! What do you think you’re doing?
Thank goodness that curse is gone!
Phew! Glad you’re finally rid of that curse.
Exquisite. I no longer smell the scent of curse upon you. You have done well to remove it.
Oh thank the Watcher! You’ve removed that curse. I was so worried.
Nice! You removed the curse. Can you remove warts too?
Oh thank the Oinker. You’ve removed that nasty curse. Oink!
I hope you’ve learned something from having that curse.
The curse is gone, this is the beginning of the new you!
Curse removal has fared well for thee. Beware future transgressions so as not to repeat history.
Getting rid of the curse? That’s no fun!
Your curse is gone? Aww. Hopefully you’ll get another soon. Hehehehe!
Good for you; you got rid of that curse. Next time maybe don’t get cursed in the first place. Just a thought.
Your curse is gone? The universe has blessed you!
Getting rid of the curse? That’s no fun!
Your curse is gone? Aww. Let me know if you want it back!
Not your best duel. Better luck next time.
Looks like you could use a little dueling practice.
Well, not every duel can be a win, right?
You lost that duel, but you can get ‘em next time!
Don’t give up so easily, you need to wake the dragon when you duel!
Hey, listen up! Duel harder next time!
Don’t let a loss get you down. You’ve gotta hop up, dust yourself off, and keep on keepin’ on.
It was pretty batty of you to think you could win that duel!
Next time, maybe think a bit more about whooooo you duel.
Don’t let defeat discourage you. Success will rise from the flames of failure.
You lost that duel?! The croaking raven doth bellow for revenge! Get them next time.
Hahaha! You really blundered that duel!
That was a bit weak... You’re going to need to get a lot better if you expect to win duels.
We can learn from defeat. Get up and duel again!
Yawn. Was that a duel or just dull? Your loss was foretold before you even began.
That looked painful. I like it!
Nice work, sometimes the stick is more important than the carrot!
You really burned it up in that duel!
YESSSSS! The heat of battle makes my blood boil in excitement. Masterful dueling!
Congratulations on the dueling win, champion.
Hey! I always fret during duels, but I am happy that you won and relieved that you’re safe.
Ribbit! You won the duel! Your opponent almost croaked!
That duel had me hopping with excitement!
You have flamed your competition! Good work winning that duel.
With brawn and mighty brains you have triumphed over your pitiful opponent. You are made to duel.
Through the eons of time and memory I have never seen a duel to be so exciting. Congratulations on your win.
That looked painful. I like it!
Wow, you’re turning out to be quite the spellcaster! Congrats!
Your powers are growing so much faster than I expected! Nice work!
You’ve reached a new spellcaster rank! Good job!
You’ve reached a new rank, can’t wait to see what spells you learn next!
You’re really getting a handle on this magic stuff, I’m impressed!
Hey! I see you have moved up the ranks! Can you do anything cool yet?
Great job reaching a new rank. Seriously, that must’ve been super hard. Like, nobody has EVER done that before, eh? For real though, I’m SOOOOO proud.
Well you’re not exactly the chosen one, but good job on the new spellcaster rank I guess.
It’s about plumbin’ time you reached a new rank. Nice plumbin’ job.
Looks like you're getting a bit hopped up on magic there. Might want to watch out.
You’re looking REALLY magical… like, maybe too much? Be careful.
Your magic charge is getting pretty strong. Might want to keep an eye on that.
I can feel your magic charge from here. Hope you know what you’re doing…
Having trouble handling your power? What does that feel like? I wouldn’t know. Perhaps monitor your spellcaster charge more closely.
Listen up! You better watch your magic charge!
Hey! Watch that magic charge of yours!
Listen, please be careful when flexing your magical muscles. Magical charge is nothing to treat so cavalier.
Your aura is starting to glow bright like my tail! Watch that magic charge!
Mind how much magic charge you try to handle. How many times have I toad you that?
It appears as if your magical energy is potent at the moment, but also wild.
Don’t flame out! You seem to be ok, but always be aware of your magical energy levels.
Fare thee well, brave spellcaster. Your power is in flux; I can feel it. Be careful how you proceed.
You’ve got a lot of magic charge there. You should go for more!
Let’s see what happens if you get even MORE magically charged. Do it! DO IT!
I can feel the dangerous amount of magic energy you’re emanating. I love danger!
Power is complimented by restraint. Use your magic charge responsibly.
I feel the energies of the stars and skies swirling uncontrollably. Beware your magical charge lest it burn you forever.
That potion didn’t quite come out right, did it?
Something looks off about that potion.
That potion looks weird. Are you sure you know what you’re doing?
Looks like you could use a little more potion practice.
Bah! You botched that potion. How will you add to my hoard if you keep failing!?
Hey! It’s okay that you failed to make that potion. You’ll get it next time. I believe in you.
Ribbit. Where’s the potion? Did it hop out of your hands?
Oink. *the leafbat looks really sad that you failed to craft that potion*
Maybe you should seek out someone whoooo knows a bit more about potions before you try to brew another?
Don’t let a mistake discourage you. Success will rise from the flames of failure.
You failed to make that potion? Please… nevermore.
Whoopsie, just a little mistake, no need to lose your head over a spilled potion though. HAHAHAHA!
Hahahaha. Well that went terribly (as expected). Nice "potion" there, Merlin.
You have failed at that potion, but hopefully you have learned. The universe will forgive this.
What happened to that potion you were trying to make? You've got me on pins and needles here!
New potion? Nifty, let’s try it out!
You learned a new potion recipe? You’re so smart!
Ahhh, a new potion recipe. Knowledge is power and power is wealth. Well done.
Hey, a new potion recipe! Cool!
You’ve learned a new potion recipe? Will that one transform me into royalty?
One oinking new potion recipe coming right oinking up!
It is indeed a wise spellcaster who stocks up on the proper recipes.
I’m burning to see what you’ll do with that new potion recipe.
Your burning thirst for knowledge is admirable. Congratulations on the new potion recipe.
Twas a brilliant move to learn that potion recipe. I wonder, pray tell, what the application will yield.
Ooooh, new potion? I hope it’s a nasty one!
Well good for you. You learned something new for a change.
Impressive, your knowledge of the arcane grows deeper.
With every bit of knowledge, you are one step closer to the mysteries of the universe.
Does that potion you just learned do icky stuff to people? I hope so!
*nibble nibble* Mmmm, a potion! Can I chew on it?
That potion smells terrible. You don’t actually drink that, do you?
Ohhh, a potion! What are you going to do with it?
A potion? I want it. What is it? I want it. What does it do? I want it.
Hey! Nice work on that potion crafting!
I hope no frogs were harmed in the brewing of that potion.
If you had to use any frogs to brew that potion, I hope I didn’t know them.
Oink. That potion looks super yummy. I wish I knew how to make one.
Exactly how many drops of potion does it take to fill to the center of a flask? Let’s count together next time.
Good work on crafting that potion. You must be feeling fired up!
You made a potion? I’m super curious; what’s it taste like?
A potion? I want it. What is it? I want it. What does it do? I want it.
If I had a digestive tract, I’d chug that potion right now!
So much power in such a tiny bottle. What will you do with that potion?
Hey, what kind of potion is that? I hope it’s the kind that does something weird to someone!
Yikes! That spell massively backfired. I’m so hoppy it didn’t do anything worse.
Oh no! Are you okay? That spell backfired!
Whoa there, maybe you need a little more spellcasting practice?
Yikes! What went wrong with that spell?
Whoops, you kinda missed that spell, huh?
Whoa! Careful! You almost hit ME with the spell backfire.
Did you mean to do that or did that spell just totally backfire?
Hey! I don’t think that spell was supposed to do that. It’s okay; better luck next time.
Yikes! That spell massively backfired. I’m so hoppy it didn’t do anything worse.
Backfire! It was pretty batty of you to think you could pull that spell off right now.
Whoooo do you think you are, losing control of your spells like that?!
Don’t let a mistake discourage you. Success will rise from the flames of failure.
It is not weakness to fail, but failed you have. That spell did not work.
Backfire! You should do that with your spells more often!
The universe is made up of infinite energy. You, however, are not. Pay more attention to your magic charge levels, friend.
Whoah! That spell did NOT do what it was supposed to do! You need better mojo.
I love it when you learn new spells!
Oh, neat! Show me your new spell!
Knowledge is eternal and the greatest of loot. I know these things from experience. You do well to learn new spells.
A new spell, eh? Well hop to it and try it out!
OINK! OINK! OINK! I’m so excited you learned a new spell!
Whooo just got a bit wiser? You, that’s whooooo! Congrats on the new spell!
I’m burning to see what you’ll do with that new spell!
You're smart to learn more spells. I’m impressed with your growing skillset. Don’t let your passion flame out.
You have a raven’s knowledge. Congratulations on learning a new spell.
Nothing like some spell knowledge to fill that empty head of yours.
A new spell? You sure you can handle it?
Impressive, your knowledge of spellcasting grows deeper.
With every bit of knowledge, you are one step closer to the mysteries of the universe. Always keep learning!
You learned a new spell? Does that one hurt or help?

A few friendly fairies are a welcome addition to any magical garden, but an infestation can cause tiny footprints, loud parties and fireballs. This sturdy fence utilizes iron -- a natural fairy repellent! Aesthetically pleasing design keeps hordes of wild fairy pests out of gardens to protect your home.
Made from melted down fences of previous homes, Phoenix Fences are examples of recycling at its finest. Phoenix Fences: so durable, they'll outlive you!
Protector from the Sun, Rain, and the Darkness of the Night.

Over centuries, balconies have performed important roles - this one is not different. Perfect for Spellcasters and Non-Spellcasters to pretend to be star crossed lovers or practicing speeches, maybe even practicing their own spell delivery to the masses!
There once was a spellcaster bar: haunted by things most bizarre. Exorcisms were held and the spirits expelled were then banished away in a jar.
Beautiful bassinet, in very good vintage condition! It is very sturdy, we promise! Perfect for newborn Spellcasters as they are starting to get in touch with their magical powers.
You can't incant on a poor night's sleep! Retreat from the world into a peaceful night of magical replenishment with this elegant bed.

All spellcasters have a third eye: the invisible mind's eye which helps with clairvoyance and links them to a higher consciousness. But is yours getting its recommended eight hours of rest? This bed features a special inlay carving to promote serenity, comfort and serve as a reminder to take care of yourself so you can be at one with the energies of the universe. Includes 300 threadcount sheets!
All the tricks you could possibly teach your familiar. Too bad they are always so stubborn they never actually listen.
1001 Tricks You Can Teach Your Familiar

By: U.K. Englishlady\n\nFollow the adventures of young spellcaster, Darley Porter, and her friends Harmony Ginger and Rowan Measley, as they solve the mystery of the shadowy chamber beneath their high school gym.
Darley Porter & The Basement of Shadows
By: Peter K. Dark\n\nThe renowned sci-fi author brings to life a terrifying alternate history where magic never existed.

By: Bro Fiery\n\nAdd a little extra "kick" to your boring, weekday recipes! Magical motes might not be the healthiest (or the most edible) ingredient, but nothing takes a dish from bland to BLAM like a little magic.

By: T.R. Ashy\n\nJulie has always been cold when it comes to showing her feelings, but can a dashing older spellcaster melt her heart? Magic is in the air in the first novel of this forty-three volume romantic series.

By: Cornelius J. Implorium\n\nThe history of spellcasting is long and extensive. In this four-thousand page volume, every feat completed and spell casted in the last two-hundred-an... Oh, it doesn't matter, no one is going to read this book.
By: Professor Toot\n\nWhich witch did switch my 'wich?? A bewitching switch does make my eye twitch!
By: Norm Solomon\n\nPhil is a practical spellcaster and Oliver studies mischief. They've been friends since childhood, but can they handle living together?

This bookshelf was once owned by spellcaster Francine Ville, a powerful herbalist. It wasn't until years later that her friends discovered Francine had been replaced with a mandrake doppelgänger of her own creation. Ville stored her extensive research of mandrakes in this very bookshelf, then hid it in the basement before running off to Sulani, leaving the mandrake to take over her "regular" life.

Proudly display your affinity for the magical arts with this bookcase, complete with grimwoire collection and power crystal. A built in cloaking spell disguises the bookcase to non-spellcasters, showing them shelves full of finance and budgeting literature.
Requires: Rank Master\nTeaches the reader a potion that will revive them immediately if they die.
Requires: Rank Adept\nTeaches the reader a potion that unlocks that power of animosity.

A Tome that contains the teachings of low ranked Spellcasters.

Requires: Rank Apprentice\nTeaches the reader a Spell that will allow them to scramble Sim's thoughts.

Requires: Rank Acolyte\nTeaches the reader a Spell to convince two Sims to argue and fight with each other.

Requires: Rank Apprentice\nTeaches the reader a Spell to harness electrical energy and give something a jolt.

Every Spellcaster's dream! Beautifully accented crystals to not only brew excellent potions, but brewing them with style. Show off how good of a Spellcaster you are by having this cauldron in your ritualistic toolkit.

For those Spellcasters that are just starting out! This low budget option is great to start tasting and testing your personal concoctions!\n\nNote: We don't guarantee the quality of the potions you brew with this, we are not sure if it really works, but hey, at least looks the part.

Like all Kingdoms, they all wish to expand. Made of iron from the thrones of kings and queens of old — as its counterpart The Iron Counter, this unit offers significant space gain, without needing to plan a siege to get it.\n\nCounter space was coming... and it was made.

Made of iron from the thrones of kings and queens of old. This unit comes pre-enchanted for all your cooking and storing needs.\n\nWe are not responsible for anything odd happening to anything that gets placed on it though, specially if made with fire and plasma.

Looking for a lighter window treatment? These breezy curtains bring a sprightly bounce to any room. Perfect for the spellcaster who wants to soak up the sun during their morning chant or afternoon sage smudging.

A lighter, breezy window treatment for larger windows. Bask in the healing nature of the sun while you peruse your favorite spells, or spy on that neighbor you've been trying to hex! The possibilities!

Fairy queens have excellent taste, which we're bringing to you at bargain prices! Add a touch of royalty to your home with these elegant curtains -- replicas of what Queen Titania has in her boudoir. There's magic in every stitch!

Perfect for creatives who are looking for a little spark of inspiration to light the way. This engraved desk harbors an actual will-o'-the-wisp, which are associated with hopes, dreams and goals. Make yours come true!

Ancient grimoires tell of a phenomenon where every thirteenth door crafted from the same materials will bring good fortune to its owners each time they pass through it. Doors 1-12 are recycled sustainably.

This baronial double door is a replica of one found in a mysterious home in Dragon Valley (or so we are told! Not sure if it is true!). The door opened into oblivion: a void described as existing outside time and space itself. Inside, a single multi-faceted hovering green rhombus. The homeowners no longer let guests inside for fear of destroying the universe. Thankfully, this replica door opens up to whatever you put it in front of. Whew!
This majestic double door brings serenity to any spellcaster's residence. Smooth, carved sandstone allows passage into a safe haven of magic. Crafted by WiseWitch Inc.

Originally built to hold up entryways in underground crystal mines, this arch can withstand thousands of pounds of surface pressure... or just hold up a second story. A fine specimen in gnomish architectural design!

The cackling witch that donated this door said it was "just an ordinary door" and assured everyone there was nothing special about it. She said it's definitely not cursed, vexed, evil, sentient, haunted, and absolutely is not made from hallucinogenic wormwood. What a nice lady!

This enchanted door is rumored to have once possessed the ability to send spellcasters back in time. The enchantment has since worn off, but previous owners have reported hearing distant songs in dead languages emanating from the other side. One owner admits the noise could have been the neighbors affinity for polka music. Investigations remain ongoing.

In these drawers lies the answer to your most burning question: what should I wear tomorrow? This fine oak dresser comes pre-enchanted with a special spell that will show you what you were meant to wear. If only all of life was this simple and stylish!

Spellcaster, divinator, and amateur furniture designer Osman Sparrow was inspired to design this ornate dresser after spilling an entire mug of tea leaves. The leaves showed him an embellished piece with botanical accents, and beautifully swirled carvings reminiscent of the tea itself. Please use coasters and drink tea responsibly!
Consuming this potion will reset all of your Spellcaster's Perk Points. Allowing them to be reassigned.
Ensures the next potion your Sim crafts is a guaranteed success. Minor side effects may include...
A classic Spellcaster companion, bats have commonly been closely associated to magic users since the times of ancients.
Familiar Orb of the Snub-Nosed Leaf Bat
This interesting creature is an unexpected entity that defies normal boundaries and demands a closer inspection. Its true nature is unknown.
Regal and powerful, this dragon should never be discounted based on its size. It is a formidable foe as well as a cherished companion.
Bathed in pure energy it is nigh impossible to make out the true form of a fairy beyond its magical wings. One can feel what can only be described as a slight spark when near.
Be warned to avoid the direct gaze of the glowfrog. They are usually quite mischievous characters although quite harmless when left to their own devices.
The preeminent symbol of magic and ancient knowledge. They have a strong connection to the moon and stoically follow their chosen Spellcaster.
Familiar Orb of the Sixam Owl
The Phoenix is intimately familiar with the cycle of life, death, and rebirth. From the ashes they arise and into the ashes they fall. So has it always been.
The harbingers of prophecy and, some say, bad luck. Ravens are an ancient creature that remain steadfast alongside their favorite Spellcasters.
When you need a protector that truly frightens your opponent consider the skull. It is hard not to be intimidated by this floating, haunting familiar.

The Veild is a Voidcritter deep with the knowledge of countless galaxies across space and time. No one really knows the true motivation of this critter, but that didn’t stop one well known kids TV show from almost featuring the Veild as a main character.
Despite this familiar being the mysterious and silent type you may still catch yourself whispering to them, “Do that voodoo that you do!”
Familiar Orb of the Hex Doll

Oh dear, a bit watery;
On some days, it seems completely empty
When not, it continues day and night
Sometimes enhanced by fright.

Ignited by magic
Sprays into the sky's reaches
Then it brims over, going to sleep...

… My wife says “haunted”. Personally, I don’t really care what ya call it. All I know is that, over the past 30 days, every time I open my new Glimmerbrook Fridge, all my stuff seems to have been moved around. In fact, I think someone swiped the other half of my haggis & cheese sandwich. Who does that? Far be it from me to judge but making a guy’s sammy disappear from the fridge… that just gives me the shivers.
This root, that is known to sometimes be shaped like a Sim, has strange properties when mixed with other ingredients.
Known to draw in many species of flies with its fragrant scent. Best keep them away from your home cooking...
A magical bush that produces Mandrake Root.
A magical bush that produces Valerian Root.

First impressions are everything! This gate was previously owned by Wizard Valishbane, the legendary socialite and host of many-a-late-night-rager for magical high society. After an incident involving a levitating punch bowl, Valishbane retired from the party circuit and retreated into a hermit lifestyle. Dazzle your guests, but party responsibly!

The Glimmerstone is given to every Spellcaster. It gives them the ability to travel to The Magic Realm once per day. If a stone is ever lost or destroyed a new one can be claimed from any of the three Sages.
This is the Spawner that will spawn Magic Motes in the world. Only Sims with Mote sight can see them.
This invisible objects is what the Sages will be attracted to to stay in their respective areas in The Magic HQ.
Magic Motes are an ancient magic that people still do not fully understand. Sages have the power to harness the motes' energy and transfer their magic into others, turning them into Spellcasters.

Named after the famous Queen of the Non-Sleepers, this light fixture is imponent and elegant, comprised of orbs filled with magical light.\n\nLegend says that in the later days of her reign, the queen had sent knights to get these light orbs from the depths of the Moon, testing the consistence of reality.
Hauntingly beautiful light can be yours with this subtle yet stately orb torch. Engineered and enchanted by WiseWitch Inc. -- your source for environmentally friendly and energy conscious energy!
Recovered from an ancient Celtic ritual site, this torch glows only for those who possess a connection to the magic realm. But even if you don't, it still looks pretty snazzy.
For spellcasters looking to purify the air in their home! This particular type of crystal's porous surface absorbs negative energy and transforms it into pure positivity. Toxicity be gone!

If I had a Simoleon for every time I’ve said to myself, “Man, I wish I had a sweet looking, jewel encrusted, artzee shmartzee fly, that is also a light, to slap on my wall to brighten up my dull rooms”… Yeah, I’d have me a bunch O’ Simoleons. Even when the Totally Lit Bug Light is not lit, it’s still totally lit, ya know. So, get the fly on the wall that everyone’s buzzing about ⁠— The Totally Lit Bug Light.

Built from the light and energy from Spellcasters of old, this sconce guides new Spellcasters through the halls in their thirst of knowledge and greatness. Every sconce seeks out the darkness to vanquish it, like a scout. But alas, it is not immortal - or is it? Repairs may be necessary.
Carved from the ancient trees of The Magic Realm. The Gnarled Broom has a natural form, twisting and turning, hopefully it doesn't fly the way it looks.
Powered by crystals from The Magic Realm, this broom travels so fast it can open inter-dimensional portals. Where they lead nobody knows!?
The Classic Wood Broom is tried and true. With just enough power to get you from point A to point B, this is the perfect broom for any new Spellcaster.
Infused with wild magic, this Rocket Broom can reach insanely fast top speeds. Go faster! Higher! Up, up, and away!
Perfect for any practical Spellcaster, the magic mop not only can get you where you need to be, it has the power to remove the toughest of stains.
This portal will allow you to travel to The Magic Realm.
Pristine Portal to The Magic Realm

These portals will allow your Sim to teleport between the matching pairs. To use them you need to place the matching Exit and Entrance on your lot, and Sims will choose to use them when it is the shortest distance to their destination.

These portals will allow your Sim to teleport between the matching pairs. To use them you need to place the matching Exit and Entrance on your lot, and Sims will choose to use them when it is the shortest distance to their destination.

This portal will allow you to travel to The Magic Realm.
Damaged Portal to The Magic Realm
Forged from the spirits of the the underworld. This wand holds strange mysteries that have yet to be discovered.
Hand-carved from the trees of Sylvan Glade, this wand holds immense power.
A basic wood wand. The perfect start to any Spellcasters collection.
Forged out of moonstones and imbued with astral vapors, this wand holds the power to a million galaxies.
Forged from the rocks deep within the crust of the Earth. This wand contains the power of every elemental.
Hand-carved by the finest woodworkers in the land. This wand is not produced by mere machines. Each one is slightly different than the last.
Far more sturdy than the Wood Wand and the Bone Wand. The Marble wand is encrusted with an elemental gem and has all the markings of elegance.
Crafted with the methods of old, this Ancient Wand hearkens back to a simpler time, a time when wands didn't represent your wealth or status, but your passion for the magic arts.
The Bone Wand is slightly more robust than classic wood variant. Just don't ask where the bones came from...
You want to see a magic trick? Perfect for any Spellcaster that likes pulling familiars out of hats... Though that trick has been banned for centuries due to familiar cruelty.

Do not be deceived by its simple look. This wand display was crafted form the wood of the ancient trees of Glimmerbrook, and has been passed down generations over generations of great Spellcasters. Display your favorite wand proudly, knowing that generations of wisdom has been passed down to you.
Come one! Come all! Grab a broom to test drive! Note: You break it - you buy it.
Come one! Come all! Grab a broom to test drive! Note: You break it - you buy it.
Trying to make that perfect potion and need ingredients fast!? Look no further - we've got what you need!
Trying to make that perfect potion and need ingredients fast!? Look no further - we've got what you need!
What we want when we want worthwhile wands! Wait no more and wander in! Our wandolier waves you over in welcome and will treat you well!
Juan's Wonderful One Stop Wand Warehouse
What we want when we want worthwhile wands! Wait no more and wander in! Our wandolier waves you over in welcome and will treat you well!
Juan's Wonderful One Stop Wand Warehouse

Forget about those old clunky Crystal Balls. They’re so 5th century. Don’t scry about it. Get with it! Get the Town Scryer Mirror and see who’s at your door BEFORE you open it right from the comfort and safety of your full-length Town Scryer Mirror. Just look deeply. You’ll be the Nostradamus of your neighborhood.
Towne Scryer Mirror – by Towne Industries

Mirror Mirror, what the heck?
Why doesn’t thou pain my neck?
I see my scalp, but that is all.
Me thinks that I have shrunk so small.
But then it’s clear for me to see
Tis hung too high for the size of me.

Illustrations from the late 1800s encyclopedia "The Science of Magic" by Doctor Fen Bittern -- the only known instance where a non-spellcaster secretly studied the magical arts. Bittern's research was dismissed and mocked by other non-spellcasters. However, in the magical community he has gained a cult-like following, and many still draw amusement from his work. Print options include "Sentient Swamp Creatures", "Poisonous Potions", or "Snowdrops and Skullflowers."
The Science of Magic Print Series

When you’re a spellcaster you live on a pretty tight schedule. If you don’t budget your magical time, it can get embarrassing – for everyone. Well, no need to stain the rug about it anymore. Just pick up the Spellcaster Scheduler and track the phases of the moon, and the ideal potion making times...but on YOUR time. Available at Badbibidibabidyboopidy.com

The center of the home is the hearth -- especially in a spellcaster home! Features a cluster of gnome-mined crystals that have been charged by moonlight for over three months. Note: crystals may or may not attract faeries and faerie rings. To prevent this please see "Fae-Away" products.

I am a rock!(Rock!)
I am a rock!(Rock!)
I am a rock!(Rock!)
Rock!
Represents intuition and omnipotent knowledge. The bigger the better!
Slightly taller! Still represents intuition and omnipotent knowledge.
Slightly leaning, in the search of more power to absorb.
Growing horizontally, for better access to power to absorb and consume.

Four score and many moons ago, lived a king who inhabited a grand, stone castle with very lengthy hallways. Though he possessed boundless riches, the king’s hallways were barren & cold. There was no known carpet that could cover such prodigious expanses at any cost. So, the king sought consultation with his wizard. The king queried the wizard, “Ever yank a large roll of toilet paper? Yeah, I want a rug that works kinda like that.” And so, it was, in the wink of that wizard’s eye, the Relentless Rugs of Repetitiveness was conjured. And, much like this description, the rug goes on and on and on and…

Is your broom in the shop again but you have an urgent levitation situation on your hands? Don’t come unraveled, man! Call GuberLift Carpets. We’ll come pick you up. Choose from 3 plush flying carpet discs that’ll drop you at work or take you around the cosmos. Leave the soaring to a GuberLift Carpet!

Where would you go if this thing worked?
Where will you land?
In another place?
In another time?
Is this a portal? We might be being deceived.

Hold onto your hemlock and nestle up to your nightshades! This classic apothecary cabinet is perfect for the organized herbalist. With ample shelf space for your canisters and vials, you'll never mix up your mugwort and nettles again.

Has this ever happened to you? You've cast your circle. The candles are set. Your sacred altar is ready. But wait...where's the incantation?! This beautiful and functional piece of furniture displays your incantation sheets so you'll never lose them again!

While it is missing the numbers to measure, this scale is still in mint working condition. Take a leap and use it for recipes, potions, and whatever you please - anything that requires little to no accuracy!
Drier, drier, plants be drier!\nHanging by a magic wire!\nNot a deceiver, your herbs are drained!
A basic packet of magical plants. What will you grow? How tall will it grow? Who knows!

Going Round & Round about how to display your Odds & Ends? Asking yourself, what are the Pros & Cons of furniture for my Odds & Ends? Can the Q&A Curio Case really keep all my Odds & Ends, Safe & Sound?...Or will the constant Opening & Closing of the Q&A Curio Case cause excessive Wear & Tear on its Fit & Finish? – Or worse - Slice & Dice my Odds & Ends? That’s a lot to go Back & Forth about it? Put aside your Fear & Loathing. Just Get it & Forget it!

At the start of his career, average illusionist, Larry Loudini (known as the OK Loudini), had an idea for a magic trick he knew would catapult him to instant celebrity. He eagerly began construction of a water-filled, steel & glass tank. Inside the tank, he would be shackled & suspended upside down. He would then make his escape from this watery debacle. Well, It was plenty dangerous! So, the OK Loudini made a few slight safety modifications to the original design. Before his first performance, he added sliding doors, an adjustable showerhead, non-slip flooring & a soap dish. Captivating. Well, Safety First!

In Greek mythology, goddess Hera took the eyes of many-eyed giant Argus and set them into the tail of the peacock. Gruesome? Perhaps. A lovely adornment for your bathroom? Definitely! No giants were harmed in the making of this sink.
Modeled after the pub stools at ancient spellcaster hangout O'Growley's pub, these stools bring a warm and relaxed atmosphere to any magical home.

After hanging up his bass guitar in the 80’s, Dr. Von Funkenstein opened a used furniture store. But selling other people’s used furniture was not enough for the frustrated doctor. So, late at night, with funk music blasting, he would take “acquired” furniture pieces & cobble together his OWN creations. It is said the doctor’s chairs would come back to life & dance to those pulsing beats as the doctor sunk deeper & deeper into funky chair madness. What? You never heard of Musical Chairs? Get yours today!
Born to Boogie – The Funkenstein Collection

This very chair was once the property of one of THE MOST average illusionists who ever lived - Larry Loudini. Touted as The OK Loudini (by some), he demonstrated his pure lack of magic & sleight of hand abilities to several people throughout much of the west side of Throckmorton, North Dakota. When Loudini finally passed over to the great beyond he left behind this fairly cool Séance chair which he never really used. Now, you can have it if you want it.
Sea god Poseidon doesn't surface much, but when he does, this seashell-carved chair is his favorite seat in the beach house.

I don’t know about you but when I begin my day I look at this loveseat and it just sings to me. I love it so much that it makes me smile & lights up my day from the inside out. I feel like I can fly on the wings on this loveseat. It’s a dee-lightful and magical experience that can only be shared by two.
On the Wings of a Loveseat

It started showing up in an old house. Some people were checking it out, it was a bench - some say - so we bought it anyway.

We named it in a whim, it was an ottoman? Eh...it was 1981 or 1881...so we went with it. It has no feelings, and it doesn't know who owns it.

I got a backyard, with nothing on it, except for this? The Hardest Seat to Sit On...
The Hardest Seat To Sit On

If you’re looking for a new sofa, the back of this sofa is looking at you. How is that possible, you may ask? Well, one day, bespectacled soothsayer, Clair Voyant, was crystal ball gazing on a sofa when she accidentally dropped her soothsaying spectacles. Of course, the sofa ate her glasses, as sofas do, & they were lost forever. But those glasses had a mighty powerful prescription & over time the back of the sofa morphed into the upside down shape of Clair’s glasses. To this day, the davenport keeps both eyes open to reunite the specs with their rightful owner.
Like all good kitchen witches, this stove encourages productivity and safety in the kitchen. Modeled after traditional wood-burning stoves but comes pre-enchanted with several fire spells.

This aethereal coffee table is hand tooled from the phantom planks of the wreckage from the doomed sailing vessel, the Flying Dutchman. This beautifully inlaid coffee table can often be seen on dark & stormy evenings, far off in the distance, mournfully sailing just above the horizon, endlessly seeking any matching sofa in the storm.

Got a coven load of friends coming over but you need to conjure up a bigger table if you’re gonna make that next séance truly magical? Now you can make ALL your gatherings magical with the Magical Gatherings Séance Table. Plenty of room for 8 of your closest believers. The glass top ensures no under the table flim-flam from the invited guests or uninvited spirits. Plus, we won’t pull the old coin trick on you for the price. It’s great for a magical night of cards with friends too!

Once upon a time, this big ol’ beautiful table was just a tiny, magical stool belonging to Carl “left ear” Lemmkey. Carl, a porch toad, lived in the bayou, on the porch of the local Spellcaster. He loved to sit on that ol’ magic stool & play his electric banjo all day & night. But that mean old spellcaster constantly nagged Carl to “turn it down!” One day, she’d had enough & tried to cast a spell on the magic stool. Unfortunately for her, it backfired & she was transformed into the AbraCaTable*. Hey, everyone knows it’s dangerous to mess with a toadstool. Get your AbraCaTable today. Free home deliverance. *Note: No one croaked in the making of this table.

This table is enchanted. No kidding. It changes to look like whatever it thinks YOU want it to look like. So, perhaps you can explain why the Magical Mystery Table has taken first place honors for best looking horseshoe mustache on an end table for the past 14 years running at the International Table Mustache Festival? Oh, you can also put stuff on it. Try doing that with any standard stache.

"When ya gotta go, ya gotta go" - ya know? Butt what if you gotta go and get to another parallel dimension in a flash? Just Flush! The Portal Potty is THE fastest and most luxurious way to go. Voted #2 Time Traveling Toidy of the year by Home & Loo Magazine. Plus, it’s got plenty of leg room & a lid that doubles as a panini press. Trust me, it’s the Plumb I tell you!*\n\n*Please remember to wash hands before returning to the present dimension.
Here lie the remains of a slinger of spells. May the memories of magic run deep and true.
Here remains a slinger of spells. May the memories of magic run deep and true.
Here remains a slinger of spells. May the memories of magic run deep and true.

Most travelers who transcend to the astral plane wander aimlessly. Gazing into the Astral Window before the spiritual journey allows the viewer to lift the haze of unknowing and reach your true destination. It's like a GPS for astral projection!
Let the moonlight in with this understated yet brilliant window. Includes a special tint to maximize the power of moonlight. The moon may be waning, but the magic doesn't have to!

Opportunity knocks but once, but if you keep a window around, it might hang out for a long time! Legends say this particular window style is said to attract plentiful opportunities. Disclaimer: buyer must discern good opportunities from bad opportunities.

Magic pirates? Was that ever a thing? Yes! This window was owned by one such pirate: Baron Von Lapis, who insisted on having it in his quarters. Von Lapis claimed the window aided in the casting of elemental spells, but we think the main selling point is that it was owned by a pirate warlock. It just has a nice ring to it.

Useful for everyone! We swear! Special crystalline glass draws power from the full moon, this window amplifies moonlit spells. Increase your night-time productivity! Also perfect for night owls and insomniacs.

Adopt the soul of a wayward spellcaster by placing this window in your home! As part of the Spellcaster Reform Program, witches or warlocks found guilty of major crimes are banished to these windows. Hopefully by observing actions of upstanding spellcaster citizens, they will one day be freed. Take a banished soul home today!

The Magic Realm is the source of all magic. Unfortunately, it is slowly being pulled apart by the swirling vortex surrounding it. The only thing that is keeping it together is the balance between the three houses of magic. Each house has a Sage that is the master in their respective style. If any imbalance is ever struct between these Sages the entire realm could collapse.

Situated in the center of Glimmerbrook this simple cottage is near the best fishing spots in all of Glimmerbrook. Not to mention the gorgeous Simstagram photos that can be taken from the nearby bridge.

Grace and Tomax have been roommates ever since they first became Spellcasters. They have day jobs, but magic is their main focus, and they've got a friendly competition going to see who will become an Adept Spellcaster first!
A local establishment that's been in Glimmerbrook as far back as anyone can remember, and though it has had some upgrades through the years, it's still full of nostalgic charm.

If peace and quiet appeals to you, the Rock Ridge Canyon is perfect. Nestled up against Glimmerbrook's towering boulders, this quaint location is sure to give any Spellcaster the silence they need to practice and study to hone their magical prowess.

The Charm family has produced generations of distinguished Spellcasters, as Minerva often reminds her children. Gemma resents her family's high expectations even though she secretly wants to make them proud. Darrel is an aspiring duelist who just got engaged to Emilia, a newly ascended Spellcaster who has a lot to live up to.
With breathtaking views of Glimmerbrook Falls, this location is perfect for any cozy home.

An ancient plot nestled deep within Glimmerbrook. Some say the previous resident was tasked with guarding an ancient relic located atop the Glimmerbrook Waterfall. Legend has it the owner disappeared one night never to be seen again. Maybe they vanished into some other dimension?

The Magic Realm is hidden deep within a vortex of swirling magic. Search for the mystical portal in Glimmerbrook if you don't already know the spell that leads there.

The Spellcaster's journey would not be complete without access to an arsenal of varied, potent spells. Search for Tomes in The Magic Realm or ask powerful Spellcasters to teach you their secrets. Good luck!

Dangerously Overcharged - Final stage of charge. Great power and magic ability. Great chance of failures, backfires, and Curses. Also, chance of Death by Overload. Magic carefully!
Charged - Spellcasting is more powerful but success chance is lightly decreased. There's also the possibility of becoming Cursed!
Overcharged - Magic is even more powerful. Success chance is moderately decreased. Curse chances are increased
Regular - In this range all magic behaves normal. No additional benefits or dangers.
Casting spells and performing magic is becoming second nature. Your skill and power is growing by leaps and bounds. You are able to train less experienced Spellcasters in the magical arts.
In addition to practicing magic you are now able to Ask more experienced, friendly Spellcasters for Magical Training. Potion crafting, spellcasting, and magical studying continues to grant knowledge.
You are able to better control and shape your magical energies by casting Build Charge. This will raise Spellcasting Charge and allow easy access to more powerful spellcasting. Be cautious.

Your prowess in the magical arts is gaining recognition. A Magical Care Package is sent to every Acolyte containing some everyday essentials for an up-and-coming Spellcaster. Be sure to check your mailbox!
The spark of magic begins to flow and swirl. Practice Magic, learn and make new potions on the Cauldron, cast spells and search for Tomes to gain experience.
You have become one of the most powerful Spellcasters in all the lands in all the worlds. You may continue to train and overmax your knowledge to gain additional talent points.

At least one of this Sim's parents had a Strong or Ancient Bloodline trait. Sims with the Ancient Bloodline trait gain an additional talent point at each Spellcaster rank to spend towards perks. They also gain Spellcaster experience faster and reduce the chance of overloading by 50%.

At least one of this Sim's parents had a Weak Bloodline trait. Sims with the Strong Bloodline trait gain an additional talent point at each Spellcaster rank to spend towards perks. They also gain Spellcaster experience faster and reduce the chance of overloading by 20%.

This Sim's parents had no Bloodline traits. Sims with the Weak Bloodline trait gain an additional talent point at each Spellcaster rank to spend towards perks. They also gain Spellcaster experience faster and reduce the chance of overloading by 10%.

Perks contain a variety of helpful ways to increase magical prowess. As one gains more experience and titles they also gain Talent Points. Invest wisely. Your Spellcaster rank determines what perks are available. Perks attached with a line must be purchased in order from the bottom.
